intro: Streptanthus glabrifolius, commonly known as the smoothleaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has smooth, narrow leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Streptanthus glabrifolius is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub environments.
